creditline: Gift of funds from the Collection in Focus Guides of The Minneapolis Institute of Arts and The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
text: Atsuita are boldly patterned inner robes that are typically used for men's roles in traditional N≈ç theater. Although mostly covered by voluminous jackets, the sumptuous designs of the atsuita are revealed when an actor moves or slips his jacket off one shoulder as he readies for combat.
title: Noh costume (atsuita)
